meanings.definition: Antiretrovirals: drugs used to treat retroviral infections, especially HIV
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed antiretrovirals to help fight the HIV virus.
meanings.sent2: She takes antiretrovirals every day to manage her HIV infection.
meanings.sent3: The antiretrovirals danced into the body, ready to battle the sneaky retrovirus.
meanings.sent4: The antiretrovirals acted like brave soldiers, attacking the invading retrovirus.
meanings.sent5: The colorful pills of antiretrovirals were her shield against the harmful retrovirus.

meanings.definition: Antiretrovirals: substances that inhibit the replication of retroviruses
meanings.sent1: Researchers are studying new antiretrovirals to stop retroviruses from multiplying.
meanings.sent2: The antiretrovirals slowed down the replication of the retrovirus in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The antiretrovirals played the role of the gatekeeper, preventing retroviruses from spreading.
meanings.sent4: Her body welcomed the antiretrovirals like a fortress, blocking the retrovirus's advance.
meanings.sent5: The tiny molecules of antiretrovirals fought bravely to halt the retrovirus's growth.

meanings.definition: Antiretrovirals: medications that help manage HIV/AIDS infections
meanings.sent1: Taking antiretrovirals regularly can control the progression of HIV/AIDS.
meanings.sent2: He relies on antiretrovirals to keep his HIV/AIDS infection under control.
meanings.sent3: The antiretrovirals whispered to the immune system, guiding it in the battle against HIV/AIDS.
meanings.sent4: Her daily dose of antiretrovirals was the key to managing her HIV/AIDS infection.
meanings.sent5: The antiretrovirals were like loyal companions, supporting her through the challenges of HIV/AIDS.
